intro: Kibara moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan kibara, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
